Items.Title: Oversight - Gun Reform in New York City
Items.MatterName: Oversight - Gun Reform in New York City

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Senate to approve S.3096, also known as the "Ballistics, Law Assistance, and Safety Technology Act" ("BLAST Act") to establish a national ballistics fingerprint database.
Items.MatterName: "Ballistics, Law Assistance, and Safety Technology Act" ("BLAST Act")

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to further restrict the issuance of a license for the possession and purchase of firearms
Items.MatterName: Restrict the issuance of a license for the possession and purchase of firearms.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass H.R. 260, which would close the background check loophole at gun shows by extending the Brady law to all sales at gun shows.
Items.MatterName: Close the background check loophole at gun shows by extending the Brady law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to limiting the acquisition of a firearm to one per ninety-day period.
Items.MatterName: Limiting the acquisition of a firearm to one per ninety-day period.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to creating a strict liability cause of action against weapons manufacturers.
Items.MatterName: Creating a strict liability cause of action against weapons manufacturers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to making it a misdemeanor to trespass upon the playing area of a professional sporting event and imposing a civil penalty for those who interfere with a professional sporting event.
Items.MatterName: Trespassing upon the playing area of a professional sporting event a misdemeanor.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the sale of a rifle or shotgun to anyone under 21 years of age, requiring firearms dealers to collect additional information from ammunition purchasers and enhancing permit information requirements.
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the sale of a rifle or shotgun to anyone under 21 years of age.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to requiring rifle and shotgun owners to obtain yearly liability insurance.
Items.MatterName: Requiring rifle and shotgun owners to obtain yearly liability insurance.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to imposing a civil penalty upon the manufacturers of certain weapons illegally used to injure or kill city employees.
Items.MatterName: Impose civil penalty upon the manufacturers of certain weapons illegally used to injure/kill city employees.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to creating a cause of action against manufacturers of certain weapons.
Items.MatterName: Create cause of action against manufacturers of certain weapons.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Legislature to limit the acquisition of a firearm to one per ninety-day period.
Items.MatterName: Limit the acquisition of a firearm to one per ninety-day period.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Assembly to amend A09255 to require that gun owners obtain liability insurance for each firearm owned.
Items.MatterName: Require that gun owners obtain liability insurance for each firearm owned. (A.09255)
